name: The 'Silence & Slot' Debrief
trigger_case: Team arguing/blaming immediately after a high-stress code
steps: Leader commands 30 seconds of absolute silence.
Round robin: Each member states one fact (no opinions) about what happened.
Each member states one thing to 'fix' for next time.
Leader closes the loop: 'We move on.'
target_outcome: Diffuses immediate emotional reactivity and switches brain to analytical mode.

name: Post-Code Blue Grounding
trigger_case: Failed resuscitation attempt leading to immediate adrenaline crash
steps: Step away from the patient bedside to a wall or corner.
Press palms firmly against the wall, engaging triceps and pectorals.
Push hard for a count of 10 while exhaling audibly.
Release tension suddenly and shake hands out.
target_outcome: Metabolizes excess adrenaline to prevent trembling and restore fine motor control.

name: The 'Parking Lot' Ritual
trigger_case: End of a 12+ hour shift preventing mental transition to home life
steps: Sit in car (or transport seat) without turning on the engine/music.
Visualize the hospital building in the rearview mirror.
Mentally pack 'patient worries' into a virtual box.
Visualize leaving the box on the curb outside the hospital.
Start engine/music to signal the start of 'personal time'.
target_outcome: Creates a psychological boundary between clinician role and personal identity.

name: Surgical Scrub Visualization
trigger_case: Pre-operative anxiety before a high-risk or complex procedure
steps: While scrubbing hands, imagine the water is washing away 'distraction'.
Visualize the procedure going perfectly step-by-step.
Associate the smell of the soap with 'competence' and 'clarity'.
Enter the OR threshold with a specific affirmation: 'I am ready.'
target_outcome: Anchors a routine physical habit to a mental state of high-performance flow.

name: Breaking Bad News Prep
trigger_case: Moments before entering a room to inform family of a patient's death
steps: Pause at the door handle. Do not open yet.
Inhale deeply for 4 seconds, expanding the diaphragm.
Hold for 4 seconds, acknowledging your own discomfort.
Exhale for 4 seconds, releasing the need to 'fix' the grief.
Enter the room.
target_outcome: Lowers provider's heart rate to allow for a calm, empathetic presence.

name: The 'Not My Emergency' Mantra
trigger_case: Overwhelmed by a patient's panic or aggressive family member
steps: Physically take one step back.
Internal monologue: 'This is their emergency, not mine.'
Internal monologue: 'I am the calm within their chaos.'
Re-engage with lowered voice volume.
target_outcome: Prevents emotional contagion and maintains professional objectiveness.

name: Needle Stick Fear Protocol
trigger_case: Anxiety when performing a procedure after a previous needle stick injury
steps: Acknowledge the fear: 'I am remembering a past event.'
Reality check: 'I am following safety protocols right now.'
Visualize the safety mechanism engaging successfully.
Proceed with the task focusing solely on the equipment, not the skin.
target_outcome: disrupts the trauma loop to allow safe completion of the task.

name: The 'Glass Wall' Technique
trigger_case: Verbal abuse from an intoxicated or delirious patient
steps: Imagine a thick, soundproof glass wall between you and the patient.
Visualize their words hitting the glass and sliding down harmlessly.
Observe their mouth moving like a silent movie.
Focus only on clinical signs (pupils, skin color) rather than words.
target_outcome: Prevents personalization of abuse and maintains clinical focus.

name: Triage Overload Breathing
trigger_case: Waiting room is full, ambulances arriving, feeling paralyzed by volume
steps: Stop moving for 10 seconds.
Box breathing: Inhale 4, Hold 4, Exhale 4, Hold 4.
Pick ONE patient to assess next.
Ignore the rest of the room until that one assessment is done.
target_outcome: Breaks the paralysis of 'too many tasks' by forcing singular focus.

name: The 'Good Death' Acknowledgement
trigger_case: Patient death in palliative care or ICU after long treatment
steps: Team pauses at bedside after family leaves.
One person names the patient.
One person states a comfort measure that was successfully provided.
Moment of silence to honor the care given, not just the outcome.
target_outcome: Reframes death as a part of care rather than a medical failure.

name: Rapid Response Adrenaline Dump
trigger_case: Shaking hands or racing heart after a Rapid Response call
steps: Find a stairwell or empty corridor.
Perform 10 rapid squats or calf raises.
Run hands under cold water for 30 seconds.
Drink a full cup of water slowly.
target_outcome: Burns off acute stress hormones to return to baseline vitals.

name: Imposter Syndrome Check
trigger_case: Resident or new nurse feeling incompetent after a difficult diagnosis
steps: Write down the specific mistake or knowledge gap.
Write down three things you did CORRECTLY in the same interaction.
Identify one resource to consult (senior, textbook) to fill the gap.
Destroy the note.
target_outcome: Balances negative bias with evidence of competence.

name: Sensory Grounding (5-4-3-2-1)
trigger_case: Panic attack onset in a supply closet or break room
steps: Name 5 things you see (e.g., gauze, monitor).
Name 4 things you can feel (e.g., scrubs, cold desk).
Name 3 things you hear (e.g., beeping, HVAC).
Name 2 things you smell (e.g., antiseptic, coffee).
Name 1 thing you can taste.
target_outcome: Pulls the brain out of emotional hijacking back to present reality.

name: The 'Chart & Release' Method
trigger_case: Constant rumination about a patient after their discharge
steps: Complete the documentation fully.
As you click 'Sign/Submit', physically exhale.
Say mentally: 'The data is safe. My responsibility for this chapter is done.'
Close the tab/window immediately.
target_outcome: Uses the digital workflow as a psychological signal for task completion.

name: Night Shift '3 AM Wall' Buster
trigger_case: Severe drowsiness and cognitive slowing during night shift
steps: Stand up and move to the brightest light source available.
Stretch arms overhead to expand rib cage.
Engage in social conversation (non-medical) for 2 minutes with a peer.
Consume cool water (avoid sugar crash).
target_outcome: Stimulates the reticular activating system to combat sleep pressure.

name: Moral Injury Mapping
trigger_case: Forced to provide substandard care due to resource lack (e.g., no beds)
steps: Identify the specific value violated (e.g., 'I want to help everyone').
Identify the external constraint (e.g., 'There are no beds').
Acknowledge the gap is 'systemic' not 'personal failure'.
Affirm: 'I did the best possible within the reality provided.'
target_outcome: Reduces guilt by externalizing systemic failures.

name: IV Failure Reset
trigger_case: Missing a difficult IV line twice, feeling judged by patient/peers
steps: Step away. Do not attempt a third time immediately.
Admit the difficulty neutraly: 'Those veins are fragile/rolling.'
Ask a colleague to try, framing it as 'fresh eyes' not 'incompetence'.
Assist the colleague to maintain team utility.
target_outcome: Prevents the 'choking' phenomenon caused by performance anxiety.

name: The 'Door Frame' Trigger
trigger_case: Moving between patients with vastly different needs (e.g., happy discharge to serious diagnosis)
steps: Designate the door frame of the patient room as a 'reset point'.
As you cross the threshold, drop the emotion from the previous room.
Assume the persona needed for the NEW room (e.g., 'Cheerleader' or 'Listener').
target_outcome: Micro-segmentation of emotional labor to match patient needs.

name: Post-Intubation Shakeout
trigger_case: Muscle rigidity in neck/shoulders after a difficult airway procedure
steps: Drop shoulders away from ears intentionally.
Rotate neck slowly in circles.
Shake hands vigorously as if flicking water off.
Take one deep 'sighing' breath.
target_outcome: Releases static muscle tension accumulated during high-focus tasks.

name: The 'Resource Audit' Check
trigger_case: Feeling completely overwhelmed by patient load/acuity
steps: List current resources: 'I have 2 techs, 1 charge nurse, and these meds.'
List immediate threats: 'Patient A is unstable.'
Match resources to threats explicitly.
Identify the 'uncovered' risk and report it to supervisor immediately.
target_outcome: Moves from vague feeling of panic to concrete resource management.

name: Pediatric Loss Candle
trigger_case: Death of a child in ER or PICU
steps: Team gathers for a brief huddle.
Turn on an electric candle (or specific light) at the station.
Acknowledge: 'This creates a shadow on our shift.'
Allow the light to stay on for the shift as a silent memorial.
Turn it off at shift end to symbolize 'leaving it here'.
target_outcome: Provides a container for heavy grief while continuing to work.

name: Compassion Fatigue Body Scan
trigger_case: Feeling numb or cynical towards patients
steps: Sit in a quiet chair.
Scan body from toes to head for tension.
Ask: 'What does my body need right now?' (Water, pee, silence, food).
Commit to meeting that one need within the next hour.
target_outcome: Reconnects the provider with their own humanity/needs.

name: Peer Check-Six
trigger_case: Noticing a colleague becoming irritable or unsafe
steps: Approach colleague discretely.
Use code phrase: 'Checking your six. You good?'
Offer a specific small help: 'Can I hang that bag for you?'
Accept their response without pushing.
target_outcome: Non-intrusive way to offer support without questioning competence.

name: Isolation Room Connection
trigger_case: Feeling isolated while treating infectious patients in PPE for hours
steps: Write your name and a smiley face/hobby on your PPE gown.
Make intentional eye contact with the patient.
Share one non-medical sentence: 'I love this weather/music.'
Acknowledge the person behind the disease.
target_outcome: Reduces the dehumanizing effect of full PPE/isolation.

name: Family Confrontation Cool-Down
trigger_case: After being yelled at by a frustrated family member
steps: Retreat to a 'safe zone' (med room/break room).
Vent physically: Squeeze a stress ball or clench/unclench fists.
Vent verbally (privately): Say 'That was really hard' out loud.
Drink water to cool literal body temperature.
target_outcome: Discharges anger safely away from patients and family.

name: The 'Error' Forgiveness Script
trigger_case: Realizing a medical error was made (medication/procedure)
steps: Write: 'I made a mistake. It was [X].'
Write: 'I am human and fallible.'
Write: 'I will report this to prevent recurrence.'
Write: 'My worth is not defined by this single moment.'
target_outcome: Moves from shame/hiding to accountability/growth.

name: Shift Change 'Shedding'
trigger_case: Changing out of scrubs at the hospital or home
steps: As you remove scrubs, imagine peeling off the 'clinician' layer.
Put on street clothes/pajamas, imagining putting on 'civilian' self.
Wash face with warm water.
Say: 'I am just [Name] now.'
target_outcome: Ritualizes the return to personal life to aid sleep/relaxation.

name: The 'End of Week' Victory Log
trigger_case: Feeling like the week was a blur of failures/stress
steps: Open phone notes app.
List 3 patients you helped (even in small ways).
List 1 interaction with a colleague that made you smile.
Read it once, then close it.
target_outcome: Combats negativity bias by proactively recording wins.

name: Palliative Transition Pause
trigger_case: Shifting care goals from 'cure' to 'comfort' (withdrawal of care)
steps: Acknowledge the shift: 'We are changing lanes now.'
Define new goal: 'Success is now a peaceful, pain-free passing.'
Release the burden of 'saving' life.
Focus on symptom management as the primary skill.
target_outcome: Aligns emotional expectations with the new clinical reality.

name: The 'Data Dump' Huddle
trigger_case: Confusion and chaos during a multi-patient trauma arrival
steps: Leader calls 'Stop. Listen.'
Everyone freezes for 10 seconds.
Leader summarizes: 'We have 3 patients. A goes to Bay 1, B to Bay 2.'
Team confirms understanding.
Resume work.
target_outcome: Resets shared mental model to prevent errors and arguments.
